doc.doc-text: Collection of general purpose language tools.
TODO
The 'grammar' itself as a java class. Required to have no-args constructor and implement net.ikarus_systems.icarus.language.Grammar interface!

Point of registration for all tokenizer implementations that desire to be included when the user is presented a list of usable tokenizers. Note that this extension-point extends the abstract 'Localizable' point but it does not require all the features inherited. In fact connected extensions can completely ommit the usage of those parameters in which case the corresponding tokenizer implementations will be identified solely by their id as declared in the plugin-xml.
The 'tokenizer' itself as a java class. Required to have no-args constructor and implement net.ikarus_systems.icarus.language.tokenizer.Tokenizer interface!
Entry point to define access to certain type of corpus resources
The 'corpus' itself as a java class. Required to have no-args constructor and implement net.ikarus_systems.icarus.language.corpus.Corpus interface!
Identifies the grammar object associated with this corpus. Used to thin out the number of corpora being displayed. Corpora that reference an unknown grammar are ignored.
Helper object for reading a certain type of 'sentence format' from an arbitrary location.
The 'reader' itself as a java class. Required to have no-args constructor and implement net.ikarus_systems.icarus.language.SentenceDataReader interface!
Identifies the grammar object associated with this reader. Used to thin out the number of corpora being displayed. Readers that reference an unknown grammar are ignored.
Helper object for saving a certain type of 'sentence format' to an arbitrary location.
The 'writer' itself as a java class. Required to have no-args constructor and implement net.ikarus_systems.icarus.language.SentenceDataWriter interface!

Identifies the grammar object associated with this writer Used to thin out the number of writers being displayed. Writers that reference an unknown grammar are ignored. If a writer is able to handle more than one grammar it should be connected to this extension-point once for every grammar it supports so that different instances are created for each.

Special entry point for 'View' extensions that only want to contribute language tool like capabilities. Typically a perspective that holds a collection of language tools will add all extensions to this extension-point to its default list of views.
Special entry point for 'View' extensions that should only be used in the corpus management context.
Perspective that allows the management of corpora instances.
Plain simple text input.
Editor for corpora using registered CorpusEditor implementations to perform the actual editing.
Default explorer to browse corpus categories and instances. Allows basic management: add, delete, rename

Outline view to display corpus fields (name, editable, type, ...) and properties. If meta-data information is available for the currently displayed corpus it will be shown as well. Supports export and copy functions for property and/or meta-data entries.

A simple synchronous corpus implementation that relies on SentenceDataReader objects to handle the actual loading of its content data. This implementation will suffice for most small or medium sized corpora.

Wrapper implementation for derived corpora that are "filtered" by an array of integers. Those indices mark the data items in the base corpus that are to be included in the "filtered" corpus. This implementation reflects the type and properties of its base corpus and forwards all listener related method calls to it.
Default editor usable for basically any type of Corpus
Editor used for derived corpora that enables the selection of a base corpus.
